fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.fs

Interface IFileWatcher


  • public interface IFileWatcher
    File system watcher, managing notification of changes to files.

    Note: do not perform any thread locking when using a listener with a watcher (for example, synchronized blocks, Object.wait() with Object.notify(), or use of Lock or related classes and interfaces). Deadlocks can occur when client code calls startWatching() or stopWatching() when holding a lock that may also be held in code invoked by listener implementations.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies
    See Also:
    IPath.getWatcher()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFileEventListener(IFileEventListener listener)
      Adds a listener for changes notified by the watcher.
      IFileSystemDriver getDriver()
      Gets the filesystem driver of the watched file or directory.
      IPath getPath()
      Gets the path of the watched file or directory.
      boolean isWatching()
      Determines if the file or directory is being watched by this watcher.
      void removeFileEventListener(IFileEventListener listener)
      Removes a listener for changes notified by the watcher.
      void startWatching()
      Starts watching the file or directory.
      void stopWatching()
      Stops watching the file or directory.

        Adds a listener for changes notified by the watcher.

        Removes a listener for changes notified by the watcher.

        listener - the listener to remove.

      • startWatching

        void startWatching()
        Starts watching the file or directory.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if watching cannot be started.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isWatching()

      • stopWatching

        void stopWatching()
        Stops watching the file or directory.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - if watching cannot be stopped.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isWatching()

      • isWatching

        boolean isWatching()
        Determines if the file or directory is being watched by this watcher.
        Returns:
        true if currently being watched, otherwise false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getDriver

        IFileSystemDriver getDriver()
        Gets the filesystem driver of the watched file or directory. This is a shortcut for getPath().getDriver().
        Returns:
        the non-null filesystem.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getPath

        IPath getPath()
        Gets the path of the watched file or directory.
        Returns:
        the non-null path.
        Since:
        1.0
